ovdesc.p: This file contains the details of whether a multi company accounting environment is being used and if so the details of the unique part of the customer account number for each company.
There is only one record on this file and the Id (key) of this record is SYSTEM
If the record is missing then T24 assumes that a non multi company accounting environment exists.
Where inter-company accounting is required then this record must be input and authorised before creating the second company.
Before this record is authorised for a inter-company accounting environment the record INTERCO must be present on the Account.Class file.

desc.p: 1-2 numeric characters in the range 1-15. This is a No Change field. This field is mandatory when the BALANCE.INTERCOMP field is set to YES.
The field controls the default select processing for enquiries in a multi book system.

Leaving this field blank would result in a user only being able to access records (subject to SMS control) that are owned by the branch they log in to. Setting it to "ALL" would result in the user being able to access records (subject to SMS control) for all branches of the lead company of the branch that they log in to.
Note that the default settings can be overridden at ENQUIRY level.
This is set when intercompany entries are to be channeled through a selected company. The main reason for setting this field is to reduce the number of intercompany accounts required.
Fields LEAD.COMPNAY, ROUTING.COMPANY and ROUTING. MNEMONIC are not set for Transaction companyâ€™s lead company then transactions routed through this company.
First precedence goes to ROUTING.COMPANY, if the same not set company in this field used as a Routing Company 1.
If there is an intercompany entry between company A and company C then the following entries will be generated.
In company A
Debit account in company A
Credit C from A intercompany account
In company C
Debit A from C intercompany account
Credit account in company C
This means that every company needs to keep intercompany accounts to link to all other companies.
Setting this field would generate the following entries if company B is set as the INTERCOMP.CO and a separate routing company not defined for company C.
In company A
Debit customer account
Credit B from A intercompany account
In company B
Debit A from B intercompany account
Credit C from B intercompany account
In company C
Debit B from C intercompany account
Credit customer account The advantage is fewer intercompany accounts, the disadvantage is more accounting entries

Maximum number of routing companies in a transaction is two.
For example
Transaction company is A, Debit account company is A, Aâ€™s LEAD.COMPANY is A,
Aâ€™s ROUTING.COMPANY is A1 which is branch company under A, Credit Account Company is B, Bâ€™s Routing company is B1 which is branch under B.
For this setup the Transaction entries are raised as shown below:
In company A
Debit account in Company A
Credit A1 from A intercompany account
In Company A1

Credit B1 from A1 intercompany account.
In Company B1

desc.p: Using these associated fields we can choose whether booking PL and TAX at customer account company is applied also we can choose for which entries this is applied i.e. PL or AC (TAX) or BOTH.
Validation Rules:

p.p: This is an option box field with values BOTH, PL, AC, PL-INCLUDE, PL-EXCLUDE, BOTH-PL-INCLUDE and BOTH-PL-EXCLUDE
BOTH - for both accounting and PL entries (STMT.ENTRY and CATEG.ENTRY).
AC - for accounting entries only (STMT.ENTRY)
PL - for PL entries only (CATEG.ENTRY)
PL-INCLUDE - only defined PL categories will be booked in the company of the customer account
PL-EXCLUDE- all PL categories except those defined will be booked in the company of the customer account
BOTH-PL-INCLUDE - defined PL and internal account categories will be booked in the company of the customer account
BOTH-PL-EXCLUDE - defined internal categories and all PL except the defined PL categories will be booked in the company of the customer account

desc.p: Using this field we control which types of internal account should be considered to follow the customer account PL booking. For example it can be restricted to particular types of tax account. Depends on the PL.MOVE field AC or PL or both categories are allowed to define
Validation Rules:

p.p: If PL.MOVE is AC or BOTH, only the Internal account categories are allowed.
If PL.MOVE is PL, no category is allowed to define.
If PL.MOVE is PL-INCLUDE or PL-EXCLUDE, only the PL categories are allowed.
If PL.MOVE is BOTH-PL-INCLUDE or BOTH-PL-EXCLUDE, Internal account categories and PL categories are allowed.
